intro: Papaver pyrenaicum subsp. corona-sancti-stephani, commonly known as the San Stefano poppy, is a rare and striking member of the Papaveraceae family. It is native to the Pyrenees region, specifically found in the high-altitude areas of Spain and France. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red, cup-shaped flowers with a distinctive white or pale yellow center. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
